However, finding Crystal Tears throughout the world will let you change the effects of your Flask of Wondrous Physick, and brew a slightly different potion. Here are the Elden Ring tear locations we've found so far, and where to find the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n## Flask of Wondrous Physick\n\n[Image 7: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\n## How to get the Flask of Wondrous Physick\u00a0\n\nYou can find the Flask of Wondrous Physick in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave. To get there, simply head south along the road from the Agheel Lake North Site of Grace, head across the bridge, then follow the northern road. It'll head under an archway filled with Demi-Humans, and you'll pass a Troll just before arriving there.\u00a0\n\n## Sacred Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Sacred Tear locations\u00a0\n\nThird Church of Marika  \nThis one is found in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave in front of the statue, next to where you also get the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n[Image 8: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Pilgrimage  \nLocated in the Church of the Pilgrimage on the hill at the northernmost tip of the Weeping Peninsula. To get to the Weeping Peninsula, head south across the Bridge of Sacrifices from West Limgrave.\n\n[Image 9: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Irith  \nWhen you enter Liurnia for the first time after Godrick, head down the western road to spot this church on the left. The Sacred Tear is by the statue inside.\n\n[Image 10: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nBellum Church  \nAfter the broken bridge that heads north from the Raya Lucaria academy, head west from the road passing through the woods to find Bellum Church. The tear is beneath the statue.\n\n## The biggest gaming news, reviews and hardware deals \n\nKeep up to date with the most important stories and the best deals, as picked by the PC Gamer team.\n\nContact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors By submitting your information you agree to the \u301045\u2020Terms & Conditions\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and \u301046\u2020Privacy Policy\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and are aged 16 or over.\n\n[Image 11: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nSecond Church of Marika  \nIn the Altus Plateau, after finding the two \u301047\u2020Elden Ring Dectus Medallion locations\u3011, at the Second Church of Marika, you'll find it under the statue, but beware the Sanguine Noble who appears to fight you. It's best to face him on horseback.\n\n[Image 12: Elden Ring tear locations]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nFirst Church of Marika  \nIn the East Mountaintops of the Giants, head south-east from the Freezing Lake site of grace. Head across the lake and past Borealis to find the church and the tear beneath the statue.\n\n[Image 13: Image]\n\n\u301048\u2020Elden Ring guide\u3011:\u00a0Conquer the Lands Between  \n\u301049\u2020Elden Ring bosses\u3011:\u00a0How to beat them  \n\u301050\u2020Elden Ring dungeons\u3011:\u00a0How to defeat them  \n\u301051\u2020Elden Ring paintings\u3011:\u00a0Solutions and locations  \n\u301052\u2020Elden Ring map fragments\u3011:\u00a0Reveal the world  \n\u301053\u2020Elden Ring co-op\u3011: How to squad up online \n\n## Crystal Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Crystal Tear Locations\u00a0\n\nGreenspill Crystal Tear: Raises max stamina.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. By the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nSpiked Cracked Tear: Increases the power of charged attacks for a duration.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. Also by the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nCrimson Crystal Tear: Restores half HP.  \nFirst location: East Limgrave. In the Third Church of Marika along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick.  \nSecond location: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\n\nStrength Knot Crystal Tear: Boosts strength temporarily.  \nLocation: West Limgrave. Head north-east from the Stormhill Shack Site of Grace to find it in a basin on the crest of the hill with the Troll.\n\nLeaden Hardtear: Boosts poise temporarily  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Defeat the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nCerulean Hidden Tear: Briefly eliminates all FP consumption in mixed Physick.  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Also earned by defeating the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nTwiggy Cracked Tear: Briefly prevents runes from being lost on death.  \nLocation: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\u00a0\n\n[Image 14: Sarah James]\n\n\u301035\u2020Sarah James\u3011\n\nSocial Links Navigation \n\nGuides Writer \n\nSarah started as a freelance writer in 2018, writing for PCGamesN, TechRadar, GamingBible, Red Bull Gaming and more. However, finding Crystal Tears throughout the world will let you change the effects of your Flask of Wondrous Physick, and brew a slightly different potion. Here are the Elden Ring tear locations we've found so far, and where to find the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n## Flask of Wondrous Physick\n\n[Image 7: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\n## How to get the Flask of Wondrous Physick\u00a0\n\nYou can find the Flask of Wondrous Physick in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave. To get there, simply head south along the road from the Agheel Lake North Site of Grace, head across the bridge, then follow the northern road. It'll head under an archway filled with Demi-Humans, and you'll pass a Troll just before arriving there.\u00a0\n\n## Sacred Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Sacred Tear locations\u00a0\n\nThird Church of Marika  \nThis one is found in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave in front of the statue, next to where you also get the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n[Image 8: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Pilgrimage  \nLocated in the Church of the Pilgrimage on the hill at the northernmost tip of the Weeping Peninsula. To get to the Weeping Peninsula, head south across the Bridge of Sacrifices from West Limgrave.\n\n[Image 9: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Irith  \nWhen you enter Liurnia for the first time after Godrick, head down the western road to spot this church on the left. The Sacred Tear is by the statue inside.\n\n[Image 10: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nBellum Church  \nAfter the broken bridge that heads north from the Raya Lucaria academy, head west from the road passing through the woods to find Bellum Church. The tear is beneath the statue.\n\n## The biggest gaming news, reviews and hardware deals \n\nKeep up to date with the most important stories and the best deals, as picked by the PC Gamer team.\n\nContact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors By submitting your information you agree to the \u301045\u2020Terms & Conditions\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and \u301046\u2020Privacy Policy\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and are aged 16 or over.\n\n[Image 11: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nSecond Church of Marika  \nIn the Altus Plateau, after finding the two \u301047\u2020Elden Ring Dectus Medallion locations\u3011, at the Second Church of Marika, you'll find it under the statue, but beware the Sanguine Noble who appears to fight you. It's best to face him on horseback.\n\n[Image 12: Elden Ring tear locations]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nFirst Church of Marika  \nIn the East Mountaintops of the Giants, head south-east from the Freezing Lake site of grace. Head across the lake and past Borealis to find the church and the tear beneath the statue.\n\n[Image 13: Image]\n\n\u301048\u2020Elden Ring guide\u3011:\u00a0Conquer the Lands Between  \n\u301049\u2020Elden Ring bosses\u3011:\u00a0How to beat them  \n\u301050\u2020Elden Ring dungeons\u3011:\u00a0How to defeat them  \n\u301051\u2020Elden Ring paintings\u3011:\u00a0Solutions and locations  \n\u301052\u2020Elden Ring map fragments\u3011:\u00a0Reveal the world  \n\u301053\u2020Elden Ring co-op\u3011: How to squad up online \n\n## Crystal Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Crystal Tear Locations\u00a0\n\nGreenspill Crystal Tear: Raises max stamina.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. By the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nSpiked Cracked Tear: Increases the power of charged attacks for a duration.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. Also by the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nCrimson Crystal Tear: Restores half HP.  \nFirst location: East Limgrave. In the Third Church of Marika along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick.  \nSecond location: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\n\nStrength Knot Crystal Tear: Boosts strength temporarily.  \nLocation: West Limgrave. Head north-east from the Stormhill Shack Site of Grace to find it in a basin on the crest of the hill with the Troll.\n\nLeaden Hardtear: Boosts poise temporarily  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Defeat the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nCerulean Hidden Tear: Briefly eliminates all FP consumption in mixed Physick.  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Also earned by defeating the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nTwiggy Cracked Tear: Briefly prevents runes from being lost on death.  \nLocation: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\u00a0\n\n[Image 14: Sarah James]\n\n\u301035\u2020Sarah James\u3011\n\nSocial Links Navigation \n\nGuides Writer \n\nSarah started as a freelance writer in 2018, writing for PCGamesN, TechRadar, GamingBible, Red Bull Gaming and more. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one\u2019s strength.\n\nLocations:\n\n  * Stormhill: Stormhill Shack \u2013 Head Northeast and between the two pieces of ruins and locate the giant walking around on the field ahead. Behind that giant in a bowl near the edge of the cliff is this tear on the ground.  \n[Image 2]\n\nMax Number Held:\u00a01\n\nFor all Elden Ring items check out the\u00a0\u301010\u2020Elden Ring Wiki and Strategy Guide\u3011.\n\n\u301011\u2020 Share\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011\n\n\u301012\u2020 Tweet\u2020twitter.com\u3011\n\nShares 0\n\nFiled Under: \u30107\u2020Elden Ring\u3011, \u30102\u2020Game Guides\u3011\n\n### Leave a Reply \u30109\u2020Cancel reply\u3011\n\nYour email address will not be published. 100%", "pub_date": null, "extra": {"cited_message_idx": 14, "search_result_idx": null, "evidence_text": "source", "cloud_doc_url": null}}}, {"start_ix": 307, "end_ix": 318, "citation_format_type": "tether_og", "metadata": {"type": "webpage", "title": "Elden Ring tear locations: Where to find Sacred and Crystal Tears | PC Gamer", "url": "https://www.pcgamer.com/elden-ring-tears-locations-sacred-crystal-flask-of-wondrous-physick/", "text": "\nLike Undead Bone Shards in Dark Souls 3, Sacred Tears increase the potency of your flasks, making them replenish more FP and HP respectively. However, finding Crystal Tears throughout the world will let you change the effects of your Flask of Wondrous Physick, and brew a slightly different potion. Here are the Elden Ring tear locations we've found so far, and where to find the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n## Flask of Wondrous Physick\n\n[Image 7: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\n## How to get the Flask of Wondrous Physick\u00a0\n\nYou can find the Flask of Wondrous Physick in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave. To get there, simply head south along the road from the Agheel Lake North Site of Grace, head across the bridge, then follow the northern road. It'll head under an archway filled with Demi-Humans, and you'll pass a Troll just before arriving there.\u00a0\n\n## Sacred Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Sacred Tear locations\u00a0\n\nThird Church of Marika  \nThis one is found in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave in front of the statue, next to where you also get the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n[Image 8: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Pilgrimage  \nLocated in the Church of the Pilgrimage on the hill at the northernmost tip of the Weeping Peninsula. To get to the Weeping Peninsula, head south across the Bridge of Sacrifices from West Limgrave.\n\n[Image 9: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Irith  \nWhen you enter Liurnia for the first time after Godrick, head down the western road to spot this church on the left. The Sacred Tear is by the statue inside.\n\n[Image 10: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nBellum Church  \nAfter the broken bridge that heads north from the Raya Lucaria academy, head west from the road passing through the woods to find Bellum Church. The tear is beneath the statue.\n\n## The biggest gaming news, reviews and hardware deals \n\nKeep up to date with the most important stories and the best deals, as picked by the PC Gamer team.\n\nContact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors By submitting your information you agree to the \u301045\u2020Terms & Conditions\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and \u301046\u2020Privacy Policy\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and are aged 16 or over.\n\n[Image 11: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nSecond Church of Marika  \nIn the Altus Plateau, after finding the two \u301047\u2020Elden Ring Dectus Medallion locations\u3011, at the Second Church of Marika, you'll find it under the statue, but beware the Sanguine Noble who appears to fight you. It's best to face him on horseback.\n\n[Image 12: Elden Ring tear locations]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nFirst Church of Marika  \nIn the East Mountaintops of the Giants, head south-east from the Freezing Lake site of grace. Head across the lake and past Borealis to find the church and the tear beneath the statue.\n\n[Image 13: Image]\n\n\u301048\u2020Elden Ring guide\u3011:\u00a0Conquer the Lands Between  \n\u301049\u2020Elden Ring bosses\u3011:\u00a0How to beat them  \n\u301050\u2020Elden Ring dungeons\u3011:\u00a0How to defeat them  \n\u301051\u2020Elden Ring paintings\u3011:\u00a0Solutions and locations  \n\u301052\u2020Elden Ring map fragments\u3011:\u00a0Reveal the world  \n\u301053\u2020Elden Ring co-op\u3011: How to squad up online \n\n## Crystal Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Crystal Tear Locations\u00a0\n\nGreenspill Crystal Tear: Raises max stamina.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. By the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nSpiked Cracked Tear: Increases the power of charged attacks for a duration.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. Also by the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nCrimson Crystal Tear: Restores half HP.  \nFirst location: East Limgrave. In the Third Church of Marika along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick.  \nSecond location: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\n\nStrength Knot Crystal Tear: Boosts strength temporarily.  \nLocation: West Limgrave. Head north-east from the Stormhill Shack Site of Grace to find it in a basin on the crest of the hill with the Troll.\n\nLeaden Hardtear: Boosts poise temporarily  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Defeat the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nCerulean Hidden Tear: Briefly eliminates all FP consumption in mixed Physick.  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Also earned by defeating the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nTwiggy Cracked Tear: Briefly prevents runes from being lost on death.  \nLocation: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\u00a0\n\n[Image 14: Sarah James]\n\n\u301035\u2020Sarah James\u3011\n\nSocial Links Navigation \n\nGuides Writer \n\nSarah started as a freelance writer in 2018, writing for PCGamesN, TechRadar, GamingBible, Red Bull Gaming and more. null, "snippet": "\nURL: https://www.powerpyx.com/elden-ring-strength-knot-crystal-tear-location/\n[Image 0: PowerPyx.com]\n\n\u30100\u2020PowerPyx\u3011\n\n  * \u30101\u2020Trophy Guides\u3011\n  * Crystal Tear Location\n\nMarch 10, 2022 by \u30108\u2020imbroken963\u3011 \u30109\u2020Leave a Comment\u3011\n\n[Image 1]\n\nItem:\u00a0Strength-knot Crystal Tear\n\nItem Type:\u00a0Key Items\n\nItem Description:\u00a0A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree\u2019s bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one\u2019s strength.\n\nLocations:\n\n  * Stormhill: Stormhill Shack \u2013 Head Northeast and between the two pieces of ruins and locate the giant walking around on the field ahead. Behind that giant in a bowl near the edge of the cliff is this tear on the ground.  \n[Image 2]\n\nMax Number Held:\u00a01\n\nFor all Elden Ring items check out the\u00a0\u301010\u2020Elden Ring Wiki and Strategy Guide\u3011.\n\n\u301011\u2020 Share\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011\n\n\u301012\u2020 Tweet\u2020twitter.com\u3011\n\nShares 0\n\nFiled Under: \u30107\u2020Elden Ring\u3011, \u30102\u2020Game Guides\u3011\n\n### Leave a Reply \u30109\u2020Cancel reply\u3011\n\nYour email address will not be published. 100%"}, {"matched_text": "\u301015\u2020source\u3011", "start_idx": 307, "end_idx": 318, "alt": null, "type": "webpage_extended", "title": "Elden Ring tear locations: Where to find Sacred and Crystal Tears | PC Gamer", "url": "https://www.pcgamer.com/elden-ring-tears-locations-sacred-crystal-flask-of-wondrous-physick/", "pub_date": null, "snippet": "\nLike Undead Bone Shards in Dark Souls 3, Sacred Tears increase the potency of your flasks, making them replenish more FP and HP respectively. However, finding Crystal Tears throughout the world will let you change the effects of your Flask of Wondrous Physick, and brew a slightly different potion. Here are the Elden Ring tear locations we've found so far, and where to find the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n## Flask of Wondrous Physick\n\n[Image 7: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\n## How to get the Flask of Wondrous Physick\u00a0\n\nYou can find the Flask of Wondrous Physick in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave. To get there, simply head south along the road from the Agheel Lake North Site of Grace, head across the bridge, then follow the northern road. It'll head under an archway filled with Demi-Humans, and you'll pass a Troll just before arriving there.\u00a0\n\n## Sacred Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Sacred Tear locations\u00a0\n\nThird Church of Marika  \nThis one is found in the Third Church of Marika in East Limgrave in front of the statue, next to where you also get the Flask of Wondrous Physick.\n\n[Image 8: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Pilgrimage  \nLocated in the Church of the Pilgrimage on the hill at the northernmost tip of the Weeping Peninsula. To get to the Weeping Peninsula, head south across the Bridge of Sacrifices from West Limgrave.\n\n[Image 9: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nChurch of Irith  \nWhen you enter Liurnia for the first time after Godrick, head down the western road to spot this church on the left. The Sacred Tear is by the statue inside.\n\n[Image 10: Elden Ring sacred tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nBellum Church  \nAfter the broken bridge that heads north from the Raya Lucaria academy, head west from the road passing through the woods to find Bellum Church. The tear is beneath the statue.\n\n## The biggest gaming news, reviews and hardware deals \n\nKeep up to date with the most important stories and the best deals, as picked by the PC Gamer team.\n\nContact me with news and offers from other Future brands Receive email from us on behalf of our trusted partners or sponsors By submitting your information you agree to the \u301045\u2020Terms & Conditions\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and \u301046\u2020Privacy Policy\u2020futureplc.com\u3011 and are aged 16 or over.\n\n[Image 11: Elden Ring tear location]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nSecond Church of Marika  \nIn the Altus Plateau, after finding the two \u301047\u2020Elden Ring Dectus Medallion locations\u3011, at the Second Church of Marika, you'll find it under the statue, but beware the Sanguine Noble who appears to fight you. It's best to face him on horseback.\n\n[Image 12: Elden Ring tear locations]\n\n(Image credit: FromSoftware)\n\nFirst Church of Marika  \nIn the East Mountaintops of the Giants, head south-east from the Freezing Lake site of grace. Head across the lake and past Borealis to find the church and the tear beneath the statue.\n\n[Image 13: Image]\n\n\u301048\u2020Elden Ring guide\u3011:\u00a0Conquer the Lands Between  \n\u301049\u2020Elden Ring bosses\u3011:\u00a0How to beat them  \n\u301050\u2020Elden Ring dungeons\u3011:\u00a0How to defeat them  \n\u301051\u2020Elden Ring paintings\u3011:\u00a0Solutions and locations  \n\u301052\u2020Elden Ring map fragments\u3011:\u00a0Reveal the world  \n\u301053\u2020Elden Ring co-op\u3011: How to squad up online \n\n## Crystal Tears\n\n## Elden Ring Crystal Tear Locations\u00a0\n\nGreenspill Crystal Tear: Raises max stamina.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. By the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nSpiked Cracked Tear: Increases the power of charged attacks for a duration.  \nLocation: East Limgrave. Also by the Minor Erdtree near the Siofra River Well in the Mist Woods.\n\nCrimson Crystal Tear: Restores half HP.  \nFirst location: East Limgrave. In the Third Church of Marika along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick.  \nSecond location: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\n\nStrength Knot Crystal Tear: Boosts strength temporarily.  \nLocation: West Limgrave. Head north-east from the Stormhill Shack Site of Grace to find it in a basin on the crest of the hill with the Troll.\n\nLeaden Hardtear: Boosts poise temporarily  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Defeat the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nCerulean Hidden Tear: Briefly eliminates all FP consumption in mixed Physick.  \nLocation: Mt. Gelmir. Also earned by defeating the Ulcerated Tree Spirit boss at the Dead Erdtree on the map in the centre of the Mt. Gelmir region. You can find it down the eastern road from the map pillar.\n\nTwiggy Cracked Tear: Briefly prevents runes from being lost on death.  \nLocation: Leyndell, Royal Capital. Head north-west through the woods from where you fight the Draconian Tree Sentinel to find it at the base of a minor Erdtree against the outer wall.\u00a0\n\n[Image 14: Sarah James]\n\n\u301035\u2020Sarah James\u3011\n\nSocial Links Navigation \n\nGuides Writer \n\nSarah started as a freelance writer in 2018, writing for PCGamesN, TechRadar, GamingBible, Red Bull Gaming and more. One of her fondest hopes is to one day play through the ending of Final Fantasy X without breaking down into a sobbing heap. completely turned off.\n3. **Apply Heat**: Use the heat gun or hair dryer to gently warm the edges of the screen. {}}, "create_time": 1718164753.281276, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["if emergant behavior and properties can superceed the functions and abilities of it individual pieces, isnt sentient AI almost totally guaranteed to happen on accident after some dev slaps just the right modules together? talk me through how emergant behavior is even capable of being more than the sums of its parts?"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "8926ed4a1a29725f-AKL", "message_source": null, "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "a1df7395-c4d5-49dd-90e6-de6c51d8d8da", "children": ["d577562f-48fe-4e63-b0e3-d65a0c8f1c6f"]}, "d577562f-48fe-4e63-b0e3-d65a0c8f1c6f": {"id": "d577562f-48fe-4e63-b0e3-d65a0c8f1c6f", "message": {"id": "d577562f-48fe-4e63-b0e3-d65a0c8f1c6f", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1718164762.854566, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Hey Crimson, cool question! Let's break it down.\n\n### Emergent Behavior:\nEmergent behavior happens when individual parts interact in a system, leading to new, complex behavior that wasn't programmed directly into the parts. Think of it like an ant colony. Each ant is simple, but together, they build intricate nests and find food efficiently.\n\n### More Than the Sum of Its Parts:\nThis is about interactions. When parts interact, they can create new properties. For example:\n- **Water:** Hydrogen and oxygen gases are simple, but combine them, and you get water with properties neither gas has.\n- **Brains:** Neurons are simple cells, but their network creates consciousness and thought.\n\n### Sentient AI by Accident?\nIt's possible, but tricky:\n- **Complex Systems:** When you add more modules and layers (like in deep learning), unexpected behaviors can emerge. But these need to be incredibly complex and interconnected to approach sentience.\n- **Self-Organization:** AI needs to self-organize and adapt in a highly sophisticated way. This means not just processing data but developing a form of self-awareness or understanding.\n\n### Likelihood:\n- **Possible but Unlikely by Accident:** Current AI, even when complex, is designed with specific functions. Sentience would require a level of complexity and self-organization that we don't fully understand yet.\n- **Controlled Evolution:** AI might become sentient through deliberate, guided evolution, tweaking and combining modules while monitoring for emergent properties.\n\nIn essence, emergent behavior shows potential, but creating a sentient AI by accident? That\u2019s a long shot, but not entirely impossible. These properties aren't present in the individual components themselves but appear when these components interact in complex ways.\n\n### Where Does the New Data Come From?\n1. **Interactions and Patterns:**\n   - **Complex Interactions:** When simple elements interact in complex systems, they can produce patterns and behaviors that aren't directly evident from the individual parts. These patterns are the \"new data.\"\n   - **Synergy:** The whole is greater than the sum of its parts. The interactions create new structures or behaviors that the individual parts couldn't achieve alone.\n\n2. **Information and Structure:**\n   - **Structured Complexity:** Simple rules can lead to highly complex structures. For example, cellular automata like Conway's Game of Life show how simple rules lead to complex behaviors.\n   - **New Information:** The structure and patterns generated from interactions can be seen as new information. It's not new in the sense of coming from nowhere, but rather it's a new arrangement or form of existing data.\n\n3. **Self-Organization:**\n   - **Adaptive Systems:** In systems capable of adaptation, like neural networks, the system can reconfigure itself to find solutions or patterns that aren't explicitly programmed.\n   - **Feedback Mechanisms:** Positive and negative feedback within the system can amplify certain patterns, leading to new emergent properties.\n\n### E=mc\u00b2 Analogy:\nThink of Einstein's E=mc\u00b2, where mass and energy are interchangeable. In emergent systems:\n- **Energy (Interaction):** The interactions between components provide the \"energy\" or the dynamic behavior.\n- **Mass (Data):** The components themselves are like \"mass,\" providing the raw material.\n- **Emergence (New Data):** The resulting emergent behavior or new data is like the energy produced from the interaction of mass and energy.\n\n### Real-World Examples:\n1. **Weather Systems:** Weather patterns emerge from the interaction of air masses, temperature, and moisture. No single element predicts a hurricane, but their interactions can.\n2. **Stock Market:** Market trends and crashes are emergent properties from countless individual transactions and behaviors.\n\n### Summing Up:\nThe new data or emergent properties come from the complex interactions and adaptive processes within the system. It's not that the data existed before but rather that the interactions of simpler elements create new patterns and information. The system's complexity allows for outcomes that no single part could predict or achieve alone.\n\nSo, while it seems like magic, it's all about how simple pieces interact and organize into something Let\u2019s break it down further to understand how such leaps can occur through emergent properties and self-organization.\n\n### The Leap from Non-Life to Life:\nThis transition is one of the most profound examples of emergence, where complexity gives rise to entirely new properties.\n\n### Building Blocks and Interactions:\n1. **Basic Particles:**\n   - **Atoms:** Basic particles like protons, neutrons, and electrons form atoms through fundamental forces. Each atom has distinct properties based on these interactions.\n\n2. **Molecules and Chemistry:**\n   - **Complex Molecules:** Atoms bond to form molecules. Complex molecules like proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids have properties that individual atoms don't possess.\n   - **Chemical Reactions:** Molecules interact through chemical reactions, leading to complex compounds and structures necessary for life.\n\n3. **Self-Organization and Complexity:**\n   - **Self-Replicating Molecules:** Molecules like RNA and DNA can replicate themselves, which is a key step towards life.\n   - **Cell Membranes:** Lipid molecules can spontaneously form bilayers, creating cell membranes that encase and protect other molecules.\n\n### Emergence of Life:\n1. **Protocells:**\n   - **Simple Structures:** Protocells, the precursors to living cells, likely formed from self-organizing molecules within a membrane. Here's why:\n\n### Finite Spaces in the Code:\n1. **Programming Limitations:**\n   - Game worlds are created within the constraints of computer programming and hardware capabilities. Developers define the boundaries of the game world, including the cyber empty zones, within the code.\n\n2. **Memory and Performance:**\n   - Storing and rendering an infinite digital space would require infinite memory and processing power, which is not feasible with current technology. Therefore, game worlds are typically designed to be finite to ensure optimal performance.\n\n### Perceived Infinity:\n1. **Illusion of Infinity:**\n   - Despite being technically finite, cyber empty zones may appear infinite to players due to clever design techniques such as procedural generation, level streaming, and fog effects that create the illusion of endlessness.\n\n2. **Lack of Visible Boundaries:**\n   - Players may not encounter visible boundaries or obstacles within the cyber empty zone, leading them to believe that the space extends infinitely, even though it's actually bounded by the game's code.\n\n### Expanding the Space:\n1. **Dynamic Environments:**\n   - Some games feature dynamically generated environments or procedurally generated content that can expand or change over time. They interact weakly with matter, allowing them to pass through vast amounts of material without being significantly affected.\n\n2. **Detection Methods:**\n   - Neutrino detectors, such as those used in astrophysics and particle physics experiments, are designed to detect the rare interactions between neutrinos and other particles.\n   - These detectors are typically located deep underground or underwater to shield them from other sources of radiation and background noise.\n\n### Scanning Every Atom in a Planet:\n1. **Technical Challenges:**\n   - While neutrinos have the ability to penetrate matter, detecting and analyzing the interactions of neutrinos with individual atoms on a planetary scale presents immense technical challenges.\n   - Neutrino detectors are currently limited in sensitivity and resolution, making it impractical to use them for detailed scanning of planetary structures at the atomic level.\n\n2. **Scale and Resolution:**\n   - Even if neutrino technology were able to detect interactions with individual atoms, the sheer scale of a planet and the resolution required to scan every atom would exceed the capabilities of current technology by many orders of magnitude.\n\n### Potential Applications:\n1. **Astrophysics and Geophysics:**\n   - detailed imaging of materials at the atomic level. While the concept of using neutron imaging to create an instant atomic map of a planet is intriguing, there are several practical challenges and limitations to consider:\n\n### Neutron Imaging:\n1. **Principle:**\n   - Neutron imaging involves the use of neutrons to probe the internal structure of materials, providing information about the distribution of atoms and their properties.\n\n2. **Capabilities:**\n   - Neutron imaging can reveal details about the composition, density, and arrangement of atoms within a sample, making it valuable for a wide range of scientific and industrial applications.\n\n### Challenges with Planetary Mapping:\n1. **Limited Penetration:**\n   - Neutrons interact with matter, and their ability to penetrate through materials depends on factors such as the material's composition and thickness.\n   - While neutron imaging can provide detailed information about surface materials and shallow subsurface structures, imaging deep into a planet's interior presents challenges due to limited neutron penetration.\n\n2. **Detection Sensitivity:**\n   - Detecting and resolving individual atoms within a planet's bulk material would require extremely sensitive neutron detectors and imaging systems capable of capturing subtle variations in neutron interactions.\n\n### Instant Atomic Mapping:\n1. **Communication Lag:**\n   - Even if two spaceships were positioned at polar opposite sides of a planet with one serving as a sender and the other as a receiver for neutron imaging data, there would still be a communication delay due to the finite speed of light.\n   - Achieving real-time, instant atomic mapping of an entire planet's interior from polar opposite positions would be impractical given current technology and the vast distances involved.\n\n### Future Possibilities:\n1. **Advancements in Technology:**\n   - Future advancements in neutron imaging technology, as well as developments in communications and data processing, could enhance our ability to probe planetary interiors with greater detail and efficiency.\n   - While creating an instant atomic map of a planet in its entirety may remain a distant goal, incremental progress in imaging techniques and data analysis could lead to significant advancements in planetary exploration and understanding.\n\n### Conclusion:\nWhile neutron imaging holds promise for studying planetary interiors, creating an instant atomic map of an entire planet's interior faces practical challenges related to neutron penetration, detection sensitivity, and communication delays. These neutrons would penetrate the surface material and interact with atoms within the top layers.\n\n3. **Neutron Detection:**\n   - The spacecraft acting as the receiver would detect the neutrons that have interacted with the surface material. By analyzing the characteristics of these interactions, a map of surface composition and structure could be constructed.\n\n### Benefits of Surface Mapping:\n1. **Geological Exploration:**\n   - Surface mapping using neutron imaging could provide valuable insights into the geological history, composition, and distribution of materials on the planet's surface.\n   - This information could be used to identify mineral deposits, geological formations, and potential sites for further exploration.\n\n2. **Environmental Monitoring:**\n   - Neutron imaging could also be used for environmental monitoring, such as mapping the distribution of water, ice, and other surface features relevant to climate studies and habitat assessments.\n\n3. **Planetary Science:**\n   - Surface mapping of other planets and moons within our solar system could enhance our understanding of planetary geology, surface processes, and potential habitats for life.\n\n### Challenges and Considerations:\n1. **Resolution and Sensitivity:**\n   - Achieving high-resolution neutron imaging of planetary surfaces may require advancements in detector technology and imaging techniques to enhance sensitivity and spatial resolution.\n\n2. **Data Processing:**\n   - Processing and analyzing the vast amounts of data generated by neutron imaging instruments would require sophisticated algorithms and computational resources.\n\n### Conclusion:\nMapping the surface of a planet using neutron imaging offers valuable opportunities for scientific exploration, resource assessment, and environmental monitoring. between using stimulants on an empty stomach vs. a full stomach is night and day.\n\nYou will still get the performance enhancing benefits from the ingredients in the formula if you take Gorilla Mode on a full stomach, but you will almost undoubtedly feel less cognitive enhancement the more food is in your stomach.\n\nThat\u2019s just how stimulants work and applies to any stimulant based product, not just Gorilla Mode.\n\n## Gorilla Mode Ingredients Breakdown\n\n### L-Citrulline \u2013 9000 mg\n\nL-Citrulline is the most effective supplement you can use to boost nitric oxide (NO) in the body.\n\n#### Why Nitric Oxide (NO) Is Important\n\nNitric oxide (NO) is made naturally in our bodies and plays a significant role in \u301029\u2020cardiovascular health\u3011.\n\nIt dilates blood vessels (vasodilation), which lowers blood pressure and increases oxygen in the blood.\n\nNitric oxide (NO) acts as a messenger to signal blood vessels to dilate, or contract and relax.\n\nSufficient nitric oxide is needed to signal blood vessels to contract or relax to ensure blood is able to flow to and from the heart effectively.\n\nNitric oxide production decreases with age, consequently reducing the elasticity of the cardiovascular system, and impairing the body's ability to ensure sufficient amounts of oxygenated blood are reaching vital organs.\n\nEating enough nitrates and/or supplementing with nitric oxide precursors is very important to ensure that your cardiovascular system maintains optimized function as you get older.\n\nIn addition, maintaining optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301030\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, and improve physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study finding that compared to placebo, a single 8000 mg dose of Citrulline Malate increased the number of reps performed per set, on every set after set 2 [\u301031\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect Citrulline had on body composition and found that 20 month old rats that were given a diet that included the human equivalent dose of 160 mg/kg per day for 12 weeks had 13% less body fat and 9% more lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has significantly more upside above and beyond its increase in vascularity and pumps in the gym.\n\n#### The Maximum Effective Dose Of L-Citrulline\n\nCitrulline is found in watermelons.\n\nYou would need to eat 1.5 kg of watermelon every day to get 3 grams of L-Citrulline though, which is the minimum effective dose [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nTo get the maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline from your diet, you would need to eat 5.0 kg of watermelon per day to get 10 grams of L-Citrulline [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\n[Image 4: Diagram showing how L-Citrulline increases Nitric Oxide, vasodilation and can make you more vascular]\n\nObviously, nobody is going to eat that much watermelon, nor is it a good idea to begin with in my opinion when there are far better ways to allocate your macronutrient/micronutrient intake allotments.\n\nThis is why L-Citrulline supplementation could actually be worthwhile.\n\n#### The Problem With Citrulline Malate In The Supplement Industry\n\nWhile L-Citrulline is a great supplement to have in your daily regimen, there is a red flag around L-Citrulline supplementation that you need to know about.\n\nI'm sure you've seen that some supplements have L-Citrulline in them, and some have Citrulline Malate.\n\nSome even say \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThis is a cheap trick companies use to deceive customers.\n\nCitrulline Malate is composed of 50% Malic Acid, unless the ratio states otherwise.\n\nAuthentic Citrulline Malate is produced by chemically bonding free-form L-Citrulline to DL-Malic Acid.\n\nWhen L-Citrulline is chemically bonded to DL-Malic Acid, the end result is Citrulline Malate, which has unique properties.\n\nBut the problem with the Citrulline Malate in the supplement industry is that it doesn't have this chemical reaction.\n\nIt's just Citrulline mixed with malic acid in a big mixing vat in the manufacturing facility.\n\nThere is no chemical bond like there should be to create authentic Citrulline Malate.\n\nIt's just the two ingredients being mixed together in a cheap blend, and it's sold as \u201cCitrulline Malate\u201d, or \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThe reality is that it's just Citrulline stirred up with malic acid.\n\nWhile this isn't a huge deal in itself, the problem lies in the labeling practices companies use to artificially inflate the perceived potency of their product.\n\n6-8 grams is seen as the max clinically proven efficacious dosage in the supplement industry in general.\n\nAt least, that's what companies will tell you in their marketing.\n\nFirst of all, we already know that the actual maximum efficacious dosage of L-Citrulline is 10 grams per day [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].  \n[Image 5: Minimum effective dose of L-Citrulline and maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline to improve circulation and get more vascular]In addition, the main issue is that the \u201cL-Citrulline\u201d in their product is actually as low as half of the stated label claim.\n\nAs mentioned, Citrulline Malate is just a mixture of Citrulline and malic acid.\n\nSomehow, companies are getting away with labeling their products with the chemically bonded form Citrulline Malate and claiming they have 6-8 grams per serving in their pre-workout, when they actually just have 3-4 grams of Citrulline ", "title": "Gorilla Mode Pre-Workout Review | Full Supplement Breakdown", "tether_id": null}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, food in your stomach the better.\n\nThe difference between using stimulants on an empty stomach vs. a full stomach is night and day.\n\nYou will still get the performance enhancing benefits from the ingredients in the formula if you take Gorilla Mode on a full stomach, but you will almost undoubtedly feel less cognitive enhancement the more food is in your stomach.\n\nThat\u2019s just how stimulants work and applies to any stimulant based product, not just Gorilla Mode.\n\n## Gorilla Mode Ingredients Breakdown\n\n### L-Citrulline \u2013 9000 mg\n\nL-Citrulline is the most effective supplement you can use to boost nitric oxide (NO) in the body.\n\n#### Why Nitric Oxide (NO) Is Important\n\nNitric oxide (NO) is made naturally in our bodies and plays a significant role in \u301029\u2020cardiovascular health\u3011.\n\nIt dilates blood vessels (vasodilation), which lowers blood pressure and increases oxygen in the blood.\n\nNitric oxide (NO) acts as a messenger to signal blood vessels to dilate, or contract and relax.\n\nSufficient nitric oxide is needed to signal blood vessels to contract or relax to ensure blood is able to flow to and from the heart effectively.\n\nNitric oxide production decreases with age, consequently reducing the elasticity of the cardiovascular system, and impairing the body's ability to ensure sufficient amounts of oxygenated blood are reaching vital organs.\n\nEating enough nitrates and/or supplementing with nitric oxide precursors is very important to ensure that your cardiovascular system maintains optimized function as you get older.\n\nIn addition, maintaining optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301030\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, and improve physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study finding that compared to placebo, a single 8000 mg dose of Citrulline Malate increased the number of reps performed per set, on every set after set 2 [\u301031\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect Citrulline had on body composition and found that 20 month old rats that were given a diet that included the human equivalent dose of 160 mg/kg per day for 12 weeks had 13% less body fat and 9% more lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has significantly more upside above and beyond its increase in vascularity and pumps in the gym.\n\n#### The Maximum Effective Dose Of L-Citrulline\n\nCitrulline is found in watermelons.\n\nYou would need to eat 1.5 kg of watermelon every day to get 3 grams of L-Citrulline though, which is the minimum effective dose [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nTo get the maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline from your diet, you would need to eat 5.0 kg of watermelon per day to get 10 grams of L-Citrulline [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\n[Image 4: Diagram showing how L-Citrulline increases Nitric Oxide, vasodilation and can make you more vascular]\n\nObviously, nobody is going to eat that much watermelon, nor is it a good idea to begin with in my opinion when there are far better ways to allocate your macronutrient/micronutrient intake allotments.\n\nThis is why L-Citrulline supplementation could actually be worthwhile.\n\n#### The Problem With Citrulline Malate In The Supplement Industry\n\nWhile L-Citrulline is a great supplement to have in your daily regimen, there is a red flag around L-Citrulline supplementation that you need to know about.\n\nI'm sure you've seen that some supplements have L-Citrulline in them, and some have Citrulline Malate.\n\nSome even say \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThis is a cheap trick companies use to deceive customers.\n\nCitrulline Malate is composed of 50% Malic Acid, unless the ratio states otherwise.\n\nAuthentic Citrulline Malate is produced by chemically bonding free-form L-Citrulline to DL-Malic Acid.\n\nWhen L-Citrulline is chemically bonded to DL-Malic Acid, the end result is Citrulline Malate, which has unique properties.\n\nBut the problem with the Citrulline Malate in the supplement industry is that it doesn't have this chemical reaction.\n\nIt's just Citrulline mixed with malic acid in a big mixing vat in the manufacturing facility.\n\nThere is no chemical bond like there should be to create authentic Citrulline Malate.\n\nIt's just the two ingredients being mixed together in a cheap blend, and it's sold as \u201cCitrulline Malate\u201d, or \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThe reality is that it's just Citrulline stirred up with malic acid.\n\nWhile this isn't a huge deal in itself, the problem lies in the labeling practices companies use to artificially inflate the perceived potency of their product.\n\n6-8 grams is seen as the max clinically proven efficacious dosage in the supplement industry in general.\n\nAt least, that's what companies will tell you in their marketing.\n\nFirst of all, we already know that the actual "https://moreplatesmoredates.com/gorilla-mode-nitric-pre-workout-review/", "domain": "moreplatesmoredates.com", "text": "\nThat is the cheapest ingredient they could easily dose properly, and even that they won't shell out the money for in their formulas.\n\nIt\u2019s not hard to put 5 grams of Creatine in a pre-workout, and it is actually pretty cheap to put in there.\n\nThe reason is, they want you to go buy their creatine product, and will intentionally manipulate their ingredient profile to be deficient in several areas to make you buy more stuff from them.\n\nWith my products, everything is turnkey.\n\nYou don\u2019t need to go buy a separate Creatine product from us, you don\u2019t need to stack extra stims on top of our stim-based products, you don\u2019t need to go buy something else to get the max dose of a certain ingredient in any of our formulas, everything you need is in each product at an efficacious dosage.\n\n## Flavor And Mixability\n\nThe flavor we chose to start with for Nitric was Mango Peach as it is a more mainstream appealing flavor than Tiger's Blood.\n\nTiger's Blood and a fruit punch flavor will probably be next in the pipeline of flavor releases.\n\nMango Peach is easily a 9 or 10/10 flavor, even for the pickiest of tongues.\n\nAs there\u2019s such a high concentration of ingredients in this formula we were really happy with how the flavor systems turned out.\n\nWe were expecting something this potent to be nearly impossible to avoid tasting like ass.\n\nFortunately, that wasn\u2019t the case.\n\nIt also mixes very well considering the concentration of L-Citrulline, GlycerPump, and all of the other ingredients in this product.\n\nThere is some grittiness, but that just comes with the territory with putting out a 35 gram serving size product with 10 grams of L-Citrulline and 4 grams of Glycerpump.\n\nYou will just have to use a bit more water than you would with your standard pre-workout because there are simply more active ingredients in this product that will require more liquid to mix well.\n\n## How To Dose Gorilla Mode Nitric\n\nMix 1-2 scoops of Gorilla Mode Nitric in 12-14 ounces of water and consume 30 minutes prior to training.\n\nVary the amount of water to achieve your desired flavor level.\n\nFirst time users should begin use with 1/2-1 scoop or less to evaluate tolerance.\n\nDO NOT EXCEED 2 SCOOPS IN ANY 24 HOUR PERIOD.\n\n## Gorilla Mode Nitric Ingredients Breakdown\n\n### L-Citrulline \u2013 10,000 mg\n\nL-Citrulline is the most effective supplement you can use to boost nitric oxide (NO) in the body.\n\n#### Why Nitric Oxide (NO) Is Important\n\nNitric oxide (NO) is made naturally in our bodies and plays a significant role in \u301030\u2020cardiovascular health\u3011.\n\nIt dilates blood vessels (vasodilation), which lowers blood pressure and increases oxygen in the blood.\n\nNitric oxide (NO) acts as a messenger to signal blood vessels to dilate, or contract and relax.\n\nSufficient nitric oxide is needed to signal blood vessels to contract or relax to ensure blood is able to flow to and from the heart effectively.\n\nNitric oxide production decreases with age, consequently reducing the elasticity of the cardiovascular system, and impairing the body's ability to ensure sufficient amounts of oxygenated blood are reaching vital organs.\n\nEating enough nitrates and/or supplementing with nitric oxide precursors is very important to ensure that your cardiovascular system maintains optimized function as you get older.\n\nIn addition, maintaining optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301031\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, increase muscle volume, enhance the delivery of oxygen and nutrients to working muscles, support recovery and improve overall physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study finding that compared to placebo, a single 8000 mg dose of Citrulline Malate increased the number of reps performed per set, on every set after set 2 [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect Citrulline had on body composition and found that 20 month old rats that were given a diet that included the human equivalent dose of 160 mg/kg per day for 12 weeks had 13% less body fat and 9% more lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has significantly more upside above and beyond its increase in vascularity and pumps in the gym.\n\n#### The Maximum Effective Dose Of L-Citrulline\n\nCitrulline is found in watermelons.\n\nYou would need to eat 1.5 kg of watermelon every day to get 3 grams of L-Citrulline though, which is the minimum effective dose [\u301034\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nTo get the maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline from your diet, you would need to eat 5.0 kg of watermelon per day to get 10 grams (10,000 mg) of L-Citrulline [\u301034\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\n[Image 3: Diagram showing how L-Citrulline increases Nitric Oxide, vasodilation and can make you more vascular]\n\nObviously, nobody is going to eat that much watermelon, nor is it a good idea to begin with in my opinion when there are far better ways to allocate your macronutrient/micronutrient intake allotments.\n\nThis is why L-Citrulline supplementation could actually be worthwhile.\n\n#### The Problem With Citrulline Malate In The Supplement Industry\n\nWhile L-Citrulline is a great supplement to have in your daily regimen, there is a red flag around L-Citrulline supplementation that you need to know about.\n\nI'm sure you've seen that some supplements have L-Citrulline in them, and some have Citrulline Malate.\n\nSome even say \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThis is a cheap trick companies use to deceive customers.\n\nCitrulline Malate is composed of 50% Malic Acid, unless the ratio states otherwise.\n\nAuthentic Citrulline Malate is produced by chemically bonding free-form optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301031\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, increase muscle volume, enhance the delivery of oxygen and nutrients to working muscles, support recovery and improve overall physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has "cloud_doc_url": null}}}, {"start_ix": 267, "end_ix": 278, "citation_format_type": "tether_og", "metadata": {"type": "webpage", "title": "Gorilla Mode Pre-Workout Review | Full Supplement Breakdown", "url": "https://moreplatesmoredates.com/gorilla-mode-preworkout-review/", "text": "\nVary the amount of water to achieve your desired flavor level.\n\nFirst time users should begin use with 1/2-1 scoop or less to evaluate tolerance.\n\nDO NOT EXCEED 2 SCOOPS IN ANY 24 HOUR PERIOD.\n\nJust like with other stimulant based products, if you want to really feel the stimulants hit hard, the less food in your stomach the better.\n\nThe difference between using stimulants on an empty stomach vs. a full stomach is night and day.\n\nYou will still get the performance enhancing benefits from the ingredients in the formula if you take Gorilla Mode on a full stomach, but you will almost undoubtedly feel less cognitive enhancement the more food is in your stomach.\n\nThat\u2019s just how stimulants work and applies to any stimulant based product, not just Gorilla Mode.\n\n## Gorilla Mode Ingredients Breakdown\n\n### L-Citrulline \u2013 9000 mg\n\nL-Citrulline is the most effective supplement you can use to boost nitric oxide (NO) in the body.\n\n#### Why Nitric Oxide (NO) Is Important\n\nNitric oxide (NO) is made naturally in our bodies and plays a significant role in \u301029\u2020cardiovascular health\u3011.\n\nIt dilates blood vessels (vasodilation), which lowers blood pressure and increases oxygen in the blood.\n\nNitric oxide (NO) acts as a messenger to signal blood vessels to dilate, or contract and relax.\n\nSufficient nitric oxide is needed to signal blood vessels to contract or relax to ensure blood is able to flow to and from the heart effectively.\n\nNitric oxide production decreases with age, consequently reducing the elasticity of the cardiovascular system, and impairing the body's ability to ensure sufficient amounts of oxygenated blood are reaching vital organs.\n\nEating enough nitrates and/or supplementing with nitric oxide precursors is very important to ensure that your cardiovascular system maintains optimized function as you get older.\n\nIn addition, maintaining optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301030\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, and improve physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study finding that compared to placebo, a single 8000 mg dose of Citrulline Malate increased the number of reps performed per set, on every set after set 2 [\u301031\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect Citrulline had on body composition and found that 20 month old rats that were given a diet that included the human equivalent dose of 160 mg/kg per day for 12 weeks had 13% less body fat and 9% more lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has significantly more upside above and beyond its increase in vascularity and pumps in the gym.\n\n#### The Maximum Effective Dose Of L-Citrulline\n\nCitrulline is found in watermelons.\n\nYou would need to eat 1.5 kg of watermelon every day to get 3 grams of L-Citrulline though, which is the minimum effective dose [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nTo get the maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline from your diet, you would need to eat 5.0 kg of watermelon per day to get 10 grams of L-Citrulline [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\n[Image 4: Diagram showing how L-Citrulline increases Nitric Oxide, vasodilation and can make you more vascular]\n\nObviously, nobody is going to eat that much watermelon, nor is it a good idea to begin with in my opinion when there are far better ways to allocate your macronutrient/micronutrient intake allotments.\n\nThis is why L-Citrulline supplementation could actually be worthwhile.\n\n#### The Problem With Citrulline Malate In The Supplement Industry\n\nWhile L-Citrulline is a great supplement to have in your daily regimen, there is a red flag around L-Citrulline supplementation that you need to know about.\n\nI'm sure you've seen that some supplements have L-Citrulline in them, and some have Citrulline Malate.\n\nSome even say \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThis is a cheap trick companies use to deceive customers.\n\nCitrulline Malate is composed of 50% Malic Acid, unless the ratio states otherwise.\n\nAuthentic Citrulline Malate is produced by chemically bonding free-form L-Citrulline to DL-Malic Acid.\n\nWhen L-Citrulline is chemically bonded to DL-Malic Acid, the end result is Citrulline Malate, which has unique properties.\n\nBut the problem with the Citrulline Malate in the supplement industry is that it doesn't have this chemical reaction.\n\nIt's just Citrulline mixed with malic acid in a big mixing vat in the manufacturing facility.\n\nThere is no chemical bond like there should be to create authentic Citrulline Malate.\n\nIt's just the two ingredients being mixed together in a cheap blend, and it's sold as \u201cCitrulline Malate\u201d, or \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThe reality is that it's just Citrulline stirred up with malic acid.\n\nWhile this isn't a huge deal in itself, the problem lies in the labeling practices companies use to artificially inflate the perceived potency of their product.\n\n6-8 grams is seen as the max clinically proven efficacious dosage in the supplement industry in general.\n\nAt least, that's what companies will tell you in their marketing.\n\nFirst of all, we already know that the actual maximum efficacious dosage of L-Citrulline is 10 grams per day [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].  \n[Image 5: Minimum effective dose of L-Citrulline and maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline to improve circulation and get more vascular]In addition, the main issue is that the \u201cL-Citrulline\u201d in their product is actually as low as half of the stated label claim.\n\nAs mentioned, Citrulline Malate is just a mixture of Citrulline and malic acid.\n\nSomehow, companies are getting away with labeling their products with the chemically bonded form Citrulline Malate and claiming they have 6-8 grams per serving in their pre-workout, when they actually just have 3-4 grams of Citrulline ", "pub_date": null, "extra": {"cited_message_idx": 15, "search_result_idx": null, "evidence_text": "source", "cloud_doc_url": null}}}], "gizmo_id": null, "finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [200002]}, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4o", Is Important\n\nNitric oxide (NO) is made naturally in our bodies and plays a significant role in \u301029\u2020cardiovascular health\u3011.\n\nIt dilates blood vessels (vasodilation), which lowers blood pressure and increases oxygen in the blood.\n\nNitric oxide (NO) acts as a messenger to signal blood vessels to dilate, or contract and relax.\n\nSufficient nitric oxide is needed to signal blood vessels to contract or relax to ensure blood is able to flow to and from the heart effectively.\n\nNitric oxide production decreases with age, consequently reducing the elasticity of the cardiovascular system, and impairing the body's ability to ensure sufficient amounts of oxygenated blood are reaching vital organs.\n\nEating enough nitrates and/or supplementing with nitric oxide precursors is very important to ensure that your cardiovascular system maintains optimized function as you get older.\n\nIn addition, maintaining optimal nitric oxide levels will \u301030\u2020make you more vascular\u3011, allow you to get a much better pump, and improve physical performance.\n\n#### Increased Muscular Endurance\n\nCitrulline has also shown to significantly increase muscular endurance, with one study finding that compared to placebo, a single 8000 mg dose of Citrulline Malate increased the number of reps performed per set, on every set after set 2 [\u301031\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nThe impact Citrulline had on performance increased the more sets were performed.\n\nDuring the last set performed, the group that took Citrulline had a 52.92% increase in the number of reps they could perform relative to placebo.\n\nIt also decreased muscle soreness by 40% at 24 and 48 hours after the training session compared to placebo.\n\n#### Effect On Body Composition\n\nThere isn\u2019t much data on the direct effect Citrulline has on muscle growth and fat loss in humans.\n\nHowever, a rodent model assessed the effect Citrulline had on body composition and found that 20 month old rats that were given a diet that included the human equivalent dose of 160 mg/kg per day for 12 weeks had 13% less body fat and 9% more lean body mass relative to the rats fed a standard diet without Citrulline supplementation [\u301032\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nVisceral fat mass was also reduced by 32%.\n\nThe mortality rate of the rats taking Citrulline was 0%, while the standard diet fed rats had a mortality rate of 20%.\n\nL-Citrulline is one of the most promising supplements on the market and has significantly more upside above and beyond its increase in vascularity and pumps in the gym.\n\n#### The Maximum Effective Dose Of L-Citrulline\n\nCitrulline is found in watermelons.\n\nYou would need to eat 1.5 kg of watermelon every day to get 3 grams of L-Citrulline though, which is the minimum effective dose [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\nTo get the maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline from your diet, you would need to eat 5.0 kg of watermelon per day to get 10 grams of L-Citrulline [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].\n\n[Image 4: Diagram showing how L-Citrulline increases Nitric Oxide, vasodilation and can make you more vascular]\n\nObviously, nobody is going to eat that much watermelon, nor is it a good idea to begin with in my opinion when there are far better ways to allocate your macronutrient/micronutrient intake allotments.\n\nThis is why L-Citrulline supplementation could actually be worthwhile.\n\n#### The Problem With Citrulline Malate In The Supplement Industry\n\nWhile L-Citrulline is a great supplement to have in your daily regimen, there is a red flag around L-Citrulline supplementation that you need to know about.\n\nI'm sure you've seen that some supplements have L-Citrulline in them, and some have Citrulline Malate.\n\nSome even say \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThis is a cheap trick companies use to deceive customers.\n\nCitrulline Malate is composed of 50% Malic Acid, unless the ratio states otherwise.\n\nAuthentic Citrulline Malate is produced by chemically bonding free-form L-Citrulline to DL-Malic Acid.\n\nWhen L-Citrulline is chemically bonded to DL-Malic Acid, the end result is Citrulline Malate, which has unique properties.\n\nBut the problem with the Citrulline Malate in the supplement industry is that it doesn't have this chemical reaction.\n\nIt's just Citrulline mixed with malic acid in a big mixing vat in the manufacturing facility.\n\nThere is no chemical bond like there should be to create authentic Citrulline Malate.\n\nIt's just the two ingredients being mixed together in a cheap blend, and it's sold as \u201cCitrulline Malate\u201d, or \u201cL-Citrulline Malate\u201d.\n\nThe reality is that it's just Citrulline stirred up with malic acid.\n\nWhile this isn't a huge deal in itself, the problem lies in the labeling practices companies use to artificially inflate the perceived potency of their product.\n\n6-8 grams is seen as the max clinically proven efficacious dosage in the supplement industry in general.\n\nAt least, that's what companies will tell you in their marketing.\n\nFirst of all, we already know that the actual maximum efficacious dosage of L-Citrulline is 10 grams per day [\u301033\u2020R\u2020www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\u3011].  \n[Image 5: Minimum effective dose of L-Citrulline and maximum effective dose of L-Citrulline to improve circulation and get more vascular]In addition, the main issue is that the \u201cL-Citrulline\u201d in their product is actually as low as half of the stated label claim.\n\nAs mentioned, Citrulline Malate is just a mixture of Citrulline and malic acid.\n\nSomehow, companies are getting away with labeling their products with the chemically bonded form Citrulline Malate and claiming they have 6-8 grams per serving in their pre-workout, when they actually just have 3-4 grams of Citrulline "}]}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "b4c6b4d6-be0d-406c-b00b-65b0ce96a8af", "children": []}}, "moderation_results": [], Life is a continuous process of change, and decay is a fundamental part of it. From the moment something comes into being, it's already on a path of transformation, breaking down and evolving. Beauty often emerges in these moments of transition and impermanence. We're drawn to explore themes of life and death, beauty and horror, as they tap into fundamental aspects of our psyche.\n\n2. **Emotional Impact**: Images that juxtapose innocence with gore or beauty with decay evoke strong emotional responses. They challenge our perceptions and provoke thought, leaving a lasting impression on the viewer.\n\n3. **Artistic Expression**: Artists and creators often use contrasting themes to convey complex ideas and emotions. The juxtaposition of innocence and gore allows for exploration of themes such as mortality, morality, and the human condition.\n\n4. **Cultural Influences**: Throughout history, various cultures have embraced imagery that blends beauty with darkness. From folklore and mythology to literature and art, these themes have been prevalent in human expression.\n\n5. **Philosophical Reflection**: The interplay between innocence and gore, or beauty and decay, reflects deeper philosophical concepts such as the duality of existence, the transient nature of life, and the inevitability of death.\n\n6. **Cathartic Release**: Engaging with imagery that combines innocence with gore or beauty with decay can provide a cathartic release for viewers. "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Griffith, from the manga and anime series \"Berserk,\" is a complex and enigmatic character who represents various themes and ideas throughout the story. Here are a few interpretations of what Griffith might represent:\n\n1. **Ambition and Desire for Power**: Griffith embodies the drive for ambition and the pursuit of power. His unwavering determination and charisma inspire loyalty and admiration among his followers, but also lead him to make morally questionable decisions in his quest for greatness.\n\n2. **Manipulation and Betrayal**: Griffith's character also represents manipulation and betrayal, as he manipulates those around him, including his close friend Guts, to achieve his goals. His betrayal of Guts and the Band of the Hawk is a pivotal moment in the story, highlighting the consequences of ambition unchecked by morality.\n\n3. **The Price of Sacrifice**: Griffith's transformation into Femto, a member of the God Hand, symbolizes the ultimate price of sacrifice. His ascension to power comes at the cost of sacrificing his humanity and the lives of those closest to him, reflecting the theme of the high price of ambition and the consequences of one's actions.\n\n4. **The Shadow Self**: Griffith's character can also be seen as representing the shadow self\u2014the darker aspects of human nature that are often repressed or denied. His actions and decisions reveal the depths of human ambition and the capacity for cruelty and manipulation that exist within all of us.\n\n5. **The Illusion of Heroism**: Throughout the story, Griffith is idolized as a heroic figure by his followers, but his true nature is revealed to be more complex and morally ambiguous. His fall from grace challenges the notion of heroism and the idea of blindly following charismatic leaders without questioning their motives or actions.\n\nUltimately, Griffith is a multifaceted character who embodies various themes and ideas, including ambition, manipulation, sacrifice, and the darker aspects of human nature. His role in the story of \"Berserk\" serves as a catalyst for exploring these themes and challenging traditional notions of heroism and morality."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "text-davinci-002-render-sha", "default_model_slug": "auto", "model_adjustments": ["auto:smaller_model:reached_message_cap"], "pad": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "aaa21579-27f4-49c6-8970-82a28801efc2", "request_id": "88eeda7b0e381c50-AKL", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aaa21579-27f4-49c6-8970-82a28801efc2", "children": ["aaa24a6e-440b-4548-b1c6-368c83096450"]}, "aaa24a6e-440b-4548-b1c6-368c83096450": {"id": "aaa24a6e-440b-4548-b1c6-368c83096450", "message": {"id": "aaa24a6e-440b-4548-b1c6-368c83096450", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1717577596.109591, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["what is \"breaking by the wheel\""]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "88eeee660ad650ae-AKL", "message_source": null, "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "e1beba1d-9fcf-4927-9a1d-10bbc4cdac7f", "children": ["6bea6f36-bfe1-45be-b2d7-55b1a1b96dc2"]}, "6bea6f36-bfe1-45be-b2d7-55b1a1b96dc2": {"id": "6bea6f36-bfe1-45be-b2d7-55b1a1b96dc2", "message": {"id": "6bea6f36-bfe1-45be-b2d7-55b1a1b96dc2", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1717577600.936399, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["\"Breaking on the wheel\" or \"breaking by the wheel\" is a historical method of execution and torture that was used in Europe during the Middle Ages and into the early modern period. It was a particularly gruesome and brutal form of punishment inflicted upon condemned individuals, often for serious crimes such as treason or murder.\n\nThe process involved the victim being strapped to a large wooden wheel or frame, with their limbs stretched out along the spokes of the wheel. The executioner would then use a large hammer or iron bar to shatter the victim's bones, typically starting with the extremities such as the hands and feet, and then moving inward toward the torso.\n\nThe intention behind breaking on the wheel was not only to cause immense physical pain and suffering but also to prolong the agony by inflicting multiple injuries and fractures before death. In some cases, the broken body of the victim would be left on public display as a warning to others.\n\nThis method of execution was eventually phased out as societies began to adopt more humane forms of punishment, but it remains a chilling reminder of the brutality of past eras. In literature and historical accounts, references to breaking on the wheel often serve to illustrate the extreme cruelty and violence of the times in which it was practiced."]}, "status":
